characters: I WANT A COOKIE. GIVE ME A COOKIE NOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow motion. Armed troops in black uniforms pour out of unmarked vans and swarm across a lawn in a middle class residential neighborhood. Yuppie neighbours look on in shock, confused. Two of the troops carry a battering ram to the front door of a white two-storey house. A leashed Rottweiler snarls and barks. In position, their comrades point M-16s into first-floor windows, ready to be ambushed. Pan into a window in the kitchen. An attractive woman in her thirties is making breakfast. Now, in regular motion, the battering ram breaks open the front door. The woman, startled, drops her spatula. INT. MURPHY RESIDENCE. DAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) Oough! Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to others) Upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troops pour into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? What's the matter? Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The troops, and one or two trenchcoated agents, continue entering the house and heading upstairs, still with rifle ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs, crowded in the narrow hallway, the troops descend on a bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off camera) Dade! Dade!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battering ram knocks down a bedroom door. INT. COURTROOM. The prosecutor, a woman of about forty, gives her closing argument blandly. She'd rather be somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defendant, Dade Murphy, who calls himself "Zero Cool", has repeatedly committed criminal acts of a malicious nature. This defendant possesses a superior intelligence, which he uses to a destructive and antisocial end. His computer virus crashed one thousand five hundred and seven computer systems, including Wall Street trading systems, single handedly causing a seven point drop in the New York Stock Market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she speaks, the camera pans across the court, panning down and stopping on the defendant: eleven year old Dade Murphy. Fast forward to the sentencing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade Murphy, I hereby fine your family forty-five thousand dollars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The court gasps, Dade's father winces

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and sentence you to probation, under which you are forbidden to own or operate a computer or touch tone telephone, until the day of your eighteenth birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Dade winces, in fact we almost expect him to cry. Opening credits roll to a backdrop of Dade and his family and lawyer fighting through a gaggle of journalists and photographers, in slow motion, and driving away. SEVEN YEARS LATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aboard a jetliner, Dade Murphy is staring blankly out the window, wearing headphones. Exterior view from the aircraft of approaching New York City. The view becomes a direct overhead of the buildings and streets of the city, which then metamorphoses (through animation) into chips and digital signals on a stylised computer board. The title logo. INT. DADE'S ROOM. Segue to Dade Murphy, now 18, wearing mirrorshades indoor and at night, working on his new computer. His mother calls him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off camera) Dade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a semi-pregnant pause) I'm taking over a TV network.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish up, honey, and get to sleep. And happy birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the OTV Studios security department, a phone rings, a man answers nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security, uh Norm, Norm speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman? This is Mr. Eddie Vedder, from Accounting. I just had a power surge here at home that wiped out a file I was working on. Listen, I'm in big trouble, do you know anything about computers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhmmm... uh gee, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, well my BLT drive on my computer just went AWOL, and I've got this big project due tomorrow for Mr. Kawasaki, and if I don't get it in, he's gonna ask me to commit Hari Kari...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh.. ahahaha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you know these Japanese management techniques. (pause) Could you, uh, read me the number on the modem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhhmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little boxy thing, Norm, with switches on it... lets my computer talk to the one there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade goes to work on OTV. He closes his eyes and a flurry of half-second video clips from old TV shows flashes by. He opens his eyes. His screen says ENTERING ARPS 331 and then wipes to another screen. Automated Record Playback System. There is a graphic representation of the station's automatic videotape changer. Dade turns on his TV set and turns to OTV. It is running a Rush-Limbaugh type TV show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV) ...so-called American Indians, Latinos and Blacks come from a genetically mediocre stock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yak yak yak. Get a job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade presses a key on his keyboard. The Video Changer diagram lights up in red. At the station, a robotic arm selects a videotape from a huge rack of thousands of tapes.  The "America First" tape slides out of the VTR an is replaced by an episode of "The Outer Limits" as Dade watches, drinks Coke and smiles, full of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are about to experience the awe and mystery, which reaches from the inner mind, to... The Outer Limits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesssss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the ARPS screen is replaced by an ominous message: U HAVE TREAD UPON MY DOMAIN & MUST NOW SUFFER WHO R U?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to type ZERO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade types: CRASH OVERRIDE. WHO WANTS TO KNOW?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade's screen dissolves into: ACID BURN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable. A hacker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the screen changes again: ACID BURN SEZ LEAVE B 4 U R EXPUNGED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Outer Limits" suddenly flashes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay "Acid Burn", that's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade starts hacking. Apparently so does Acid Burn. The tape changer machines at OTV are swamped, sometimes fighting over the same tape. The program on TV keeps changing. The message comes up on Dade's computer screen: I WILL SWAT U LIKE THE FLY U R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More dueling tape changers, more half second video clips. Another message. I WILL SNAP YOUR BACK LIKE A TOOTHPICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the duel continues, Dade types back a taunt of his own MESS WITH THE BEST DIE LIKE THE REST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last from Acid Burn: YOU ARE TERMINATED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then his own computer confirms for him that the connectio is terminated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit on me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next morning. Mrs. Murphy is unpacking. Dade emerges from his room in a housecoat. He makes a beeline (dodging moving boxes) for the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. You unpack your stuff yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up all night again, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can this wait until both my eyes are open, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade's mom picks up the phone, mocking a call to the building superintendent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I cut the electricity to his room so he'll sleep normal hours? He's been playing with his computer all night for a solid week. (pause) Well yes, he could be playing with himself. Mmm hmm. Yes I'll ask. Dade, you like girls, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, I just haven't found one as charming as you yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't been doing anything stupid, right, Dade? (louder) Right, Dade?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, mom. And I'm still a virgin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade slams the bathroom door. Mrs. Murphy quickly checks his room. Dade is showering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry, through the bathroom door) You hooked it up to the phone, didn't you? Dade! Turn the shower off! You screw up again and you won't get into college!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses and regains some of her cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry we had to move in your senior year. I didn't want to sell the house but I had to take this new job, you know that. You're going to love New York, it's the city that never sleeps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We enjoy several views of New York, the morning sun shining between skyscrapers, neon signs that stay lit day and night. Dade emerges from the ground-floor apartment on rollerblades and skates down the street to school. INT. HIGH SCHOOL. At school, hundreds of teenagers converse, move around, head to class.  Dade looks lost among them. He walks up to a skinny latino kid in a faux leopard-skin muscle shirt. The kid is on a pay-phone, speaking in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, chill man, I'm talking to Venezuela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm sorry, I was just looking for the principal's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I can't help you, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Dade really looks lost. He heads off in search of the office. INT. OFFICE. Dade is filling out a form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have your transfer forms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade stares at her, stunned. The girl has a decidedly unconventional appearance, yet is a first-rate beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a relatively straightforward question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade notices her lips, and in his imagination launches into a flurry of half-second video clips and art bites, all involving lips and kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you speak English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, you wanted...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted transfer forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives them to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts leaving. He doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade clues in, gets up and follows her. She takes him on a brief tour. INT. HIGH SCHOOL CORRIDOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym is through there, and the cafeteria is through there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Cool. (pause) What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. Kate Libby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at a classroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My... class. You mean I'm not in your class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not in my class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate starts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy in the halls notices Dade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you new?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him about the pool, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, there's an Olympic size swimming pool up on the roof. Take the stairs over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate starts away again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade enters, and lets the door slam behind him. Across th roof, a dozen or so geeky looking kids are looking over the edge, apparently trying to get someone's attention. One of them notices Dade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hold the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's too late. The geeks look pretty angry. There is no p Dade (realizing he's been had) No pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade tries the door but it's locked. He hammers it with his palm, furious. Above, thunder roars and it begins raining. INT. SCHOOL CORRIDOR. Dade is soaking wet, and trudges among his classmates leaving a muddy trail. A three-second video clip rolls through his mind: it is a screaming woman being strangled in an old movie. He walks past Kate, who giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! He found the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are all seated at computer workstations. Dade is hacking, the latino kid who was on the phone to Venezuela is running a demo involving dirty-dancing skeletons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mr. Simpson. And I'm subbing for Ms. Bayliss who was arrested at the anti-fur rally. I know some of you kids got computers at home. But these are school property, people, and I don't want to see any gum stuck to 'em. Chapter 1. Designing graphical interface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the latino kid notices that Dade has been looking up Kate Libby's school records. And hacking himself into her advanced English class. EXT. SCHOOL QUAD. It's after school, kids are heading home, Dade too. The latino kid notices Dade and catches up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, um, what's your interest in Kate Libby, eh? Academic? Purely sexual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homicidal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, man? I'm the Phreak!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name rings no bells with Dade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Phantom Phreak? The king of Nynex? I know you play the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another kid, younger and a little geeky looking, runs up to Dade and The Phantom Phreak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phreakphreakphreakphreakphreak, dudedudedudedudedudedude... I gotta...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps Joey) Joey, Joey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? whatwhatwhat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more "dude" out of you and I'm gonna slap the shit outa you, okay? Now I'm trying to save you from yourself but you gotta stop letting your mama dress you, man! (To Dade): Check it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phreak starts to hand Dade a flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I need a handle, man. I don't have an identity until I have a handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're right about that. (to Dade) Check it, Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phreak hands Dade a flyer for Cyberdelia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. How about the Master of Disaster, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hopeless, man, utterly hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phreak walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ultra Laser. (desperate) Doctor Doom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade rolls in on rollerblades.  Street vendors hawk computer parts and bootleg software. A bootleg music vendor catches Dade's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out, each and every one of you. Compilation tape, of my own making. I call this the "Greatest Zooks Album". Featuring artists like, well I got some Hendrix on there, some Joplin, Mama Cass, Belushi... all great artists that asphyxiated on their own vomit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small crowd around him finally gets the joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't get this in stores, man, I made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade wheels into Cyberdelia, which just happens to be equipped with a ramp down to its main floor for the benefit of skaters. The place pounds with loud, bassy techno music and coloured light. Video monitors with psychedelic patterns complete the atmopshere. There is a video game with a huge screen.  Phreak is at a pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Please deposit five dollars for the first minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phreak holds a small box up to the receiver, presses a button, and the box emits a series of tones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonono, thank YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade checks out the scene. Kate is playing the big video game. Dade skates up to her. She loses her last man. She's got the high score, in fact her name dominates the top-10 list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nice score for a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated by Dade's presence) Think you can do better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give it a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate yields the controls to Dade, who begins playing. Kate's boyfriend looks on from a mezzanine several feet above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this kid bothering you, Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, can I get some room here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (to Kate) Why don't you come up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate obliges and joins Curtis.  Dade continues playing. He plays brilliantly. The game is a flashy 3-D high-speed chase game with lots of surprises. Dade loses, but his high score is about to come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade's score comes up. He's in the #1 position. Phreak is amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Well, it looks like I'm on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, defeated, leaves. Curtis follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. No one's ever beat her before. You just made an enemy for life. (to someone else) Boy meets world. Let's go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Curtis are sucking face, oblivious to the busy world around them. Dade and Phreak watch, more than a little disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, you're looking at it, he just looks slick all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Curtis start to take off on Curtis' motorcycle. Kate and Dade make eye contact briefly. The motorcycle speeds off into the night. INT. DADE'S ROOM. The clock says it's 4:16. As the camera pans up to Dade, it changes to 4:17. Dade is hacking again. It's the school's administration system. Dade schedules a test of the school sprinkler system for 9:30am. INT. HIGH SCHOOL CORRIDIR. Dade stands alone in the hall, watching the time closely. Phreak rounds a corner and meets Dade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade doesn't answer. He watches the time a couple of more seconds, then opens an umbrella. Immediately the fire sprinklers turn on. Phreak starts getting drenched. He realizes what is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused and highly impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. You... A bell rings and students pour out into the halls by the hundreds. They're all being showered on. A tall cheerleader bounces by Phreak, pushing her pom-pom in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way cool! (to Dade) You saw that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade nods in the affirmative. Kate walks up to Dade, also understanding what has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pool on the roof must have a leak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate gives Dade a look that could kill and skulks away. Dade walks away under his umbrella, smug and dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, oh man, this is gonna be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade, Kate, and a couple of other students are writing on the chalkboard. Kate finishes first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If God gave men brains bigger than dogs', they wouldn't hump womens' legs at cocktail parties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth Libby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure your mother qualifies as a significant author of the twentieth century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her last book sold two million copies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost in unison) Woooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teacher reads Dade's quotation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Angel-headed hipsters burning for the ancient heavenly connection to the starry dynamo in the machinery of the night."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Ginsburg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not in this class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said give me time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not enrolled in this class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's on my list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate leaps across a desk and snatches the list from the teacher. Dade is on it. She gives Dade another filthy look, both Dade and the teacher just shrug. The teacher moves on to Cereal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Of all the things I've lost, I miss my mind the most?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozzy Osbourne!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. What is your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teacher grabs the list back from Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Emmanuel Goldstein, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, however, are not on my list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in mock shock) Whoa, this isn't wood shop class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class cracks up. Kate and Dade exchange looks as the teacher escorts Cereal to the door. INT. DADE'S PLACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eating) Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did we learn in school today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaah. Did we meet someone special?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No one special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I gotta get back to work. I'm gonna be home late.  And would you try and please fill these out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She indicates a pile of college applications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh don't worry, it's only the rest of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Anything else, you want me to mow the lawn? Oops, forgot. New York. No grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And unpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves. Dade looks over the college applications for a second, and pushes them away. He'd rather not do this now. INT. CYBERDELIA. Dade, Phreak and Joey are sitting at a table. Joey is giving a dull account of his hacking adventures. Enter Cereal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FYI, alright man, you can sit at home, and do like absolutely nothing and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal pauses, notices Dade, whom he has never met formally but seen around, and then continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and your name goes through like seventeen computers a day. 1984, yeah right man, that's a typo. Orwell's here and now, he's living large. We have no names, man, no names. We are nameless. Can I score a fry? Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet Cereal Killer. As in Froot Loops? But he does know things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade and Cereal acknowledge each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyways, guys, guys, listen, listen to me. I'm in this computer right? So I'm looking around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cereal) D'you bring those Crayola books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, technicolor rainbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal brings a book out of his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that, what is that? Lemmie see. What are these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: International Unix Environments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal pulls out another book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luscious orange?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal hands the orange book to Phreak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer security criteria, DOD standards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another book comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pink Shirt Book, Guide to IBM PCs. So called due to the nasty pink shirt the guy wears on the cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devil book. The Unix Bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dragon book. Compiler design.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal brings out a large red book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Red Book. NSA Trusted Networks. Otherwise known as the Ugly Red Book that won't fit on a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now Phreak has made a pile of the books, and the Red Book looks wholly out of place on the top of the pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, anyway, guys guys guys, come on. I'm in this computer, right. So I'm looking around, looking around, you know, throwing commands at it, I don't know where it is or what it does or anything. It's like, it's like choice, it's just beautiful, okay. Like four hours I'm just messing around in there. Finally I figure out, that it's a bank. Right, okay wait, okay, so it's a bank. So, this morning, I look in the paper, some cash machine in like Bumsville Idaho, spits out seven hundred dollars into the middle of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's kinda cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was me. That was me. I did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did this from your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey takes a drag from his cigarette and just nods, with big grin on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, stoned or stupid? You don't hack a bank across state lines from your house, you'll get nailed by the FBI. Where are your brains, in your ass? Don't you know anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid, man. It's universally stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys always think I should know everything, and you never tell me anything. Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, what are the three most commonly used passwords?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love, secret, and uh, sex.  But not in that order, necessarily, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but don't forget God. System operators love to use God. It's that whole male ego thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you wanna be elite? You gotta do a righteous hack. None of this accidental shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, you want a seriously righteous hack, you score one of those Gibsons man. You know, supercomputers they use to like, do physics, and look for oil and stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't no way, man, security's too tight. The big iron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. But, if I were gonna hack some heavy metal, I'd, uh, work my way back through some low security, and try the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but oh man, (starts rubbing one of his own nipples in mock sexual excitement) wouldn't you just love to get one of those Gibsons, baby? Ooooh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, who ate all of my fries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal pauses a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pretending to be enraged) Joey?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, no, nonononono, I didn't touch your fries. I did not touch your fries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal, man, you owe me a pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was him, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're psyched. You need to lay off of that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joey) I'm gonna hit you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey is hacking. A Gibson. He gets in. Using GOD as a password. Nice graphics represent the machine's vast systems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YES! Home run, home run. You and me Lucy. We're gonna show em baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A system operator at Ellingson Mineral Corporation, a large oil company, notices the intrusion. He gets on the phone. INT. PLAGUE'S LOFT. The place is a mess, typical of the hacker bachelor pad. Empty chinese food boxes and Jolt Cola cans litter the place. Plague's phone is ringing, waking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Mr. Belford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sleepily) My name is the Plague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Mr. The Plague, uh, something weird's happening on the net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As in what, you hapless techno-weenie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, the accounting subdirectory in the Gibson is working really hard. We got one person online, the workload is enough for like ten users. I think we've got a hacker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, we need proof that we were here. Right, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey starts looking for something to download as proof he was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Garbage, okay, give me Garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He selects a Garbage file and starts the download. His screen becomes a psychedelic mind trip. INT. COMPUTER ROOM, ELLINGSON MINERAL. The Plague glides in on a skateboard. Short and thin, bearded, about 35 but still trying to be a teenage anarchist, yet not consciously realizing he sold out that ideal years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never fear. I is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've narrowed the activity to terminal 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's echo 23, see what's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge monitor lights up with the display of the Gibson's resources. Hal and the Plague watch. Plague starts "surfing" around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "God" wouldn't be up this late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees what Joey is downloading. A file called "Garbage".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Get me the switching control center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts on a telephone headset. Hal dials for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the headset) I need to trace a call that's in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey is sneaking a cigarette while his computer downloads There is a knock at the door. It's his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Shit! (loudly, panicked) Uh yeah... hold on, mom. Hold on one second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts out the cigarette and sprays the room with air freshener.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it! Open the door, Joseph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, uh, yeah, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unlocks the door. Joey's mom bursts in. He's still clambering into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bed. Sleep. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns off the computer. It wasn't finished downloading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet dreams, Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get a trace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Yeah, we got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey takes a disk out of his computer and stashes it in a air vent in the cieling. INT. TENEMENT HALLWAY. Phreak, Dade and Cereal are rollerblading through the halls of an apartment building that is filled with graffiti. It appears that most of the spray-bomb art was created by the residents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice place, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal knocks on a door spray-painted "Hackstock"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard of a hacker called Acid Burn? You know who he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) No, don't know who he is. (to Cereal) Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal shrugs. A hooded black man in his early twenties answers the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikon! Lord Nikon this is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phreak motions to Dade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing) Crash Override.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of you. Done anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikon slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phreak knocks the door again. Nikon opens again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, your mom buy you a 'Puter for Christmas? (to Phreak) Does he know anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure man, he's elite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pausing, checking Dade out) Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Nikon, can I... can I crash at your place tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (removing his hood) Again? (pauses, then grins broadly) Yeah sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikon and Cereal do a fake Kung-fu move together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooka-pow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later, the four are watching TV. On TV is a secret service agent giving a news interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV) Hackers penetrate and ravage delicate public and privately owned computer systems, infecting them with viruses, and stealing materials for their own ends. These people, they are terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Richard Gill, You're hacker enemy number one, man. You're a boner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, showtime, showtime!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheesy music plays. Razor and Blade, androgynous asian brothers, have a community access TV show. "Wayne's World in eye liner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to our show!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hack the Planet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hack the Planet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For those late night hacks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolt Cola! The soft drink of the elite hacker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are these guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Razor and Blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Razor and Blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Razor and Blade have a disconnected payphone in their studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, this IS a payphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in unison) Don't ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you can see, this is just a simple microcassette recorder. (shows the microcassette recorder)  Hook it up to the phone and drop in five bucks in quarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Record the tones that the coins make. And hang up and get your money back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And never again have to pay for a service that would be dirt cheap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...IF it weren't run by a bunch of profiteering gluttons!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, hacking is more than just a crime. It's a survival trait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey is taking a shower, wearing walkman headphones, singing along with the music. Joey finishes, turns off the shower, still singing. He draws open the shower curtain to find two secret service agents with shotguns pointed at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREEZE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What? What did I do? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agents drag Joey, still naked and wet, out of the shower and into the living room. His mother is hysterical..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in there! Sit down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down there. Don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey is pushed into a sofa. He sees his computer, "Lucy", being carried away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey dives onto the agent carrying Lucy away, losing his towel.  His mother, seeing his exposed buttocks, is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police-type vehicle pulls up. It's Agent Richard Gill of the Secret Service.  He stops a young agent for an update.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going, Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks good, sir. We've got an uncorrupted hard drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In English, please. I didn't spend ten years protecting the president so I could finish my career feeling like an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir. We caught him by surprise, so we don't think he had time to erase his computer files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Good man. Alright, let's finish up here, and take him in for interrogation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They split up.  A reporter and her sound man run up to Gill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Gill, can you spare a moment of your time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why of course, Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Jennifer conducts the interview, agents lead Joey into an unmarked car. His mother is behind him, still hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just how dangerous are hackers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hackers penetrate and ravage delicate public and privately owned computer systems, infecting them with viruses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and stealing sensitive materials for their own ends. These people, they're terrorists...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tall, impressive building. A cavernous atrium filled with busy people. INT. ELLINGSON BOARDROOM. A handsome looking woman in her late thirties walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Gentlemen. Please be seated. I see we're still dressing in the dark, Eugene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Margo) Once again, don't call me Eugene. (to the board) A recent unknown intruder penetrated, using a superuser acount, giving him access to our whole system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely what you're paid to prevent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone didn't bother reading my carefully prepared memo on commonly used passwords. Now, as I so meticulously pointed out, the for most used passwords are love, (gesturing lewdly) sex, secret and... (eyeing Margo) ...God. So would your holiness care to change her password?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margo just blinks prettily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hacker planted the virus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday, the ballast program for a supertanker training model mistakenly thought the vessel was empty, and flooded its tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if to a child) The little boat flipped over. A virus planted in the Gibson computer system claimed responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, it left a note?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plague hits a button on a remote control, and the virus - a long haired male model - appears on a large screen, in psychedelic colors. The virus speaks in a hammy Italian accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless five million dollars are transferred to the following numbered account in seven days, I will capsize five tankers in the Ellingson fleet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) That is the virus. Leonardo da Vinci. The problem is we have twenty six ships at sea and we don't know which ones are infected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, put the ships' ballasts under manual control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing anymore, Duke. These ships are totally computerized. They rely on satellite navigation, which links them to our network, and the virus, wherever they are in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are we supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well luckily, you have a gifted and talented security officer. I traced the hacker's call. The secret service picked him up this morning. I'll just search his files for the original virus code, and then I can eliminate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plague, Margo and two suits from the boardroom are riding down an escalator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look, now we expect you to get onto this right away, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're working on it as fast as we can. This is a very common occurrence in corporations as large as ours. You have nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you're sure about that, Mr. The Plague?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the Secret Service is helping us out 100 percent. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be in touch. Talk to you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suits get off the escalator, Plague and Margo take th next one down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to move fast. The hacker copied my garbage file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I created Mister da Vinci so we could call in the Secret Service. So they'd arrest the hacker, sieze his equipment, things that we can't do on our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go to jail for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. Think about the 25 million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you've created a virus that's going to cause a worldwide ecological disaster, just to arrest some hacker kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically, uhmm, yeah. Mmm hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. You know, you're sick, Eugene. You...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh, sh sh sh sh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plague stops a passing secretary and snatches a piece of paper from her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can cancel it any time. I don't need any program code. But it's the perfect cover, to confiscate the disc and find out how much of that garbage file has been copied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it! (walking away) Why did I ever trust you? (going back up the escalator) Get the file. Otherwise you'll lose all your toys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey is distraught over the dismantling of Lucy. Agent Ray examines the Mac's innards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find the program for the virus on any of the discs we confiscated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's either very smart or very stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he stashed it somewhere, or he has an accomplice. We'll release him until his indictment, keep tight surveillance, and see if he leads us to your disc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's apartment building is an L-shaped skyscraper about 30 storeys high, unimpressive by New York City standards. Two Secret Service agents are staking Joey out in a car outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unit 3 outside suspect Joey Pardella's apartment. Nothing to report. Suspect still grounded... by his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His radio crackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to this bullshit. (he reads) "This is our world now. The world of the electron and the switch, the beauty of the baud. We exist without nationality, skin color, or religious bias. You wage wars, murder, cheat, lie to us and try to make us believe it's for our own good, yet we're the criminals. Yes, I am a criminal. My crime is that of curiosity. I am a hacker and this is my manifesto." Huh, right, manifesto? "You may stop me, but you can't stop us all."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's cool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not caring for where Bob is going with this) It's cool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not cool. It's commie bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade, Cereal and Phreak check their faces. Cereal brushes his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Phreak) So what do you think, can I crash at your place tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it with this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His parents missed Woodstock and he's been making up for it since. Hey, you hear about Joey's bust?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Probably had something to do with that bank in Idaho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he could hack a Gibson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. His mom said he's grounded for his next three lifetimes. (imitating her) He isn't to consort with his computer friends. (himself again) The secret service is really out to get him. (changes the subject) Hey there's a big party tonight, you wanna go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's at Kate's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought so!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal and Phreak leave, Cereal dancing. INT. PLAGUE'S OFFICE. Plague is wearing a VR helmet and gloves, playing some sort of action game. He is unaware that Gill has just entered the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? Plague!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thumps the VR pedestal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLAGUE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plague finally notices, and takes off the helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we've got something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill hands Plague a folder. It has the logo of Stanton Hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uuugh, hard copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plague looks it over and recognizes a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's after school. Dade's just unlocking the front door, only to find a Secret Service agent behind it.  And one behind him in the hallway. Both point pistols at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret Service!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slam Dade against a wall and start frisking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ! What is the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, man? Get off me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lead him into his room and throw him down on the bed Plague is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sit in the bed and keep your hands where we can see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The year was 1988.  And this nasty virus crashed fifteen hundred systems in one day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade has a flashback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen hundred and seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (astounded) Wow, huh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It got you seven years probation. No computer, couldn't even use a touch tone phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have been hell, huh? Zero Cool? (getting to the point) A virus has been planted in the Ellingson Mineral computer system. You were our prime suspect, till we trashed your stuff and found no trace of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However, we have come to believe that one Joey Pardella is involved in this Ellingson virus. He or perhaps his accomplice has a disk that Mr. Belford needs to disable that virus. We want you to help us find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three secret service agents leave Plague and Dade alone.  Plague shuts the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of Gill) Loser. (continues) I can't believe you were only eleven when you wrote this. It's quite an impressive virus. Dade, I know how you might feel about narking on your friends, but, we're hackers. For us, there's no such thing as family and friends. We're each our own country, with temporary allies and enemies. I'd like to make a treaty with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one who understands you. Now, can we be allies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I don't play well with others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plague is holding Dade's baseball bat. He shrugs, turns around, and smashes Dade's stereo to smithereens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Shh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Pervert! What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI computer holds files on twenty million Americans.  I just hacked into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From here I got access to every piece of data ever stored on Dade Murphy's parents. His parents separated five years ago, reconciled two years later, filed for divorce last year, custody battle, boy chose to go with his mother. Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we get the mother, we get the boy.

dialogues.text: Kate's room is empty, and Dade can't resist going back in to play with her laptop, which far outclasses his own, some more. On the balcony, Kate notices and comes back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Yeah. It's not just the chip, it has a PCI bus. But you knew that.

dialogues.text: Indeed. RISC architecture is gonna change everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. RISC is good.

dialogues.text: They uncomfortably exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure this sweet machine's not going to waste?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crash Override. What was it. "Mess with the Best, Die Like the Rest?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.text: Are you challenging me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I win, you become my slave.

dialogues.text: Make it our first date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: MONTAGE: Scenes of Dade and Kate preparing for the challe

dialogues.text: (voice over) So here's the deal. The chosen contest: To hassle Secret Service Agent Richard Gill, and get one back for Joey.

dialogues.text: Dade spray paints camouflage onto his keyboard.

dialogues.text: Our decisions are final, by a vote of 2 to 1. No appeals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Whose gonna notify his next of kin?

dialogues.text: Dade and Kate shake hands and the challenge begins. EXT. NEW YORK CITY PUBLIC PHONE. At a public phone, Kate hacks into Concourse Bank, looks up Richard Gill, and has his credit card maxed out. "Destroy Card" is the final instruction. The other hackers look on. INT. RESTAURANT. A waiter runs a credit card through a validation machine, sees the message and returns to the patron's table. It is Richard Gill. Right there, the waiter chops the MasterCard in two with a pair of scissors, to Gill's horror. EXT. NEW YORK CITY PUBLIC PHONE. Dade hacks into an electronic personal ads system and changes an ad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I... I know where you can stick it... I know where you can stick it...

dialogues.text: Hey! Hey, ow! Do you know who I am? Do you know who I am?

Kate wakes up gasping.  It was only a dream. She pants and regains her breath. Then she smiles. She enjoyed that dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooohhhh...

dialogues.text: Dade walks off. INT. DADE'S PLACE. Dade signs an electronic pad for a package from UPS. He takes the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the door and opens the package. It is a laptop computer, clear plastic shell, full colour screen. Very high-end, perhaps the equal to Kate's machine. He turns it on. The Plague's face, distorted, appears. It speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to know who I am, Zero Cool? Well let me explain the New World Order. Governments and corporations need people like you and me. We are samurai. The keyboard cowboys. And all those other people out there who have no idea what's going on are the cattle. Mooo! I need your help, you need my help. Let me help you earn your spurs. Ahh, think about it. Enjoy the laptop, "Cool"! Tell me where the disk is.

dialogues.text: Plague's face vanishes. INT. JOEY'S ROOM. Joey lies on his bed with a comic book, looking despondent. His mother enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look pitiful. Okay, okay, you're not grounded anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses his forehead and leaves. He springs back to life, gets up and gets the disc from where he stashed it in the air vent. EXT. PARK. Joey is nervously waiting on a park bench. Phreak arrives Agents Ray and Bob still have Joey staked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude dude dude, I gotta talk to you a minute, listen listen listen. I copied a garbage file from...

dialogues.text: Nono, it's like hot or something. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Joey hands Phreak the disc. Agent Bob is taking pictures, and Phreak notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, Joey, you've got a tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey sees, and runs for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.text: The agents split up, one runs after Joey, the other after Phreak. INT. HIGH SCHOOL BOYS' ROOM. Phreak has lost his tail. He puts Joey's disc behind a condom machine in the boys' room at school, and sticks it there with gum. INT. PHREAK'S ROOM. Phreak frantically destroys all records of his hacking career. He knows he's about to be busted. DREAM SEQUENCE. The Secret Service is about to burst in on Phreak. He still hasn't destroyed any records, and starts manically going through everything. Gill is on his laptop screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm watching you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knock on the door. Phreak awakes. It's his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramon? Wake up. Ramon! Wake up! Vamano. Time for school, come on.

dialogues.text: The secret service bursts in through the window just as Phreak's mom opens the blind. She screams, Phreak leaps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret Service, don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deja vu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Sanchez, you are under arrest, under the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act of 1986.
