dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for, arrest me already!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The undersized Phreak is just a morsel to the hardened thugs behind these bars and they taunt him viciously as h is led to his one phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get one call. Uno. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop locks the dial on the phone. Phreak waits for the cop to leave, and hangs up. He starts rapidly pushing the hangup hook, and he hears a ringing tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, operator services.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, operator? I'm having trouble dialing a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What number please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phreak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm freaking! Joey wasn't making it up! He really hacked into Ellingson! He gave me the disc with a file he copied and now I'm in jail! They're charging me with some serious shit! And there's stuff I didn't even do, like inserting some virus called Da Vinci, and they keep asking about you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they're going to bust us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! You better figure out what's on that disc, cause we're being framed. It's in that place where I put that thing that time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up just as the cop returns. INT. SCHOOL BOYS' ROOM. Kate is entirely out of place in the boys' room, as the boys look on amusedly.  She finds the disc behind the condom machine and pockets it. Then she buys a condom fro the machine and struts out, smiling sweetly, hot as fire. INT. DADE'S PLACE. Kate knocks. Mrs. Murphy lets Kate and Cereal in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! (looking Kate over) Well, now I see what all the fuss is about. (she shows them to Dade's room) Dade... you have company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a nice room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do my ears deceive me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonononono. Truce, you guys. Listen, we got a higher purpose here, alright? A wake up call for the Nintendo Generation. We demand free access to data, well, it comes with some responsibility. When I was a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child, but when I became a man I put away childish things. (pause) What... It's Corinthians I, Chapter 13, verse 11, no duh. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phreak and Joey are being framed. We need your help to figure out what's on this disc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. Everybody who touches that thing gets busted, I can't afford to get arrested, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should just go to the bathroom or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it with you? I know we've been playing games, but, we're supposed to be on the same side and we really need your help. I really need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, could you just make a copy of the disc? And just hide it in case we get busted, so we have something to give our lawyers, something that hasn't been tampered with? Can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knock on the door. Dade's mom peeks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen you guys, help yourself to anything in the fridge. Cereal has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mrs. Murphy) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll copy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later.  Plague phones Dade. Plague has Lauren Murphy's records on his screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl. The girl has the disc I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I don't play well with others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn on your laptop. Set it to receive a file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade does. An extensive criminal record with a strange woman's picture comes up. The strange woman transforms into Dade's mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren Murphy is now a wanted felon in the state of Washington. Forgery, Embezzlement, two drug convictions, plus she jumped parole. When she's arrested, she will not have a trial, she will not pass go, she will go directly to jail. Then I change this file back to the original, and your mom disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I tell you. Computers never lie, kid. Your mom will be arrested at work, she'll be handcuffed, and later, strip searched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lay a finger on her and I'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid, don't threaten me. There are worse things than death and, uh, I can do all of them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade emerges from his room. His exhausted, overworked mother is asleep on the couch. He pulls a blanket over her. EXT. PUBLIC PHONE, WET STREET, NIGHT. Shortly after, Dade is outside on a payphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. But listen, Kate didn't know what's on it. I mean, she came to me to figure it out. She's not the one who planted the virus. You leave her alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't worry, kid. If she's innocent, she'll be fine. Your mommy's safe now, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade hangs up and waits for some time.  A limousine drive by, with a skateboarder tailing. Plague grabs the disc, jumps in the limo and speeds away. Dade tries to chase but gives up quickly. INT. KATE'S ROOM. Dade shows up.  Kate, Nikon, and Cereal are working on th disc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, hold on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a second!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this, it's so lean and clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a hacker wrote it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, look at this. This thing is dense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikon points out part of the code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's ill, man. It's incomplete. This is taking forever and a day to figure out. I'm gonna make some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade takes Nikon's place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tag, you're in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours pass. Dade studies and reverse engineers the garbage file. The other hackers watch, and do just about anything but be hackers. Finally, over boxes of half-finished pizza, Dade makes an announcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a virus. It's a worm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this one eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It nibbles. You see this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade indicates a rapidly scrolling data display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is every financial transaction Ellingson conducts, yeah? From million dollar deals to the ten bucks some guy pays for gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm eats a few cents from each transaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no one's caught it because the money isn't really gone. It's just data being shifted around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. And when the worm's ready, it zips out with the money and erases its tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey got cut off before he got to that part. Check it out. By this point, it's already running at, what, twice the speed as when it started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, and at this rate it ends its run in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And judging by this segment alone, it's already eaten about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21.8 million bucks, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikon whistles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever wrote this needs somebody to take the fall. And that's Phreak, and that's Joey, and that's us. We've got to get the rest of the file, so we can find out where the money is going before the worm disappears, so we can find out WHO created it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know who wrote it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Ellingson security creep. I gave him a copy of the disc you gave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know what was on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated) Oh man. That's universally stupid, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, man, you an amateur, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did he come to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a record. I was Zero Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero Cool? Crashed fifteen hundred and seven systems in one day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikon closes his eyes and access his photographic memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggest crash in history, front page, New York Times, August 10th, 1988. I thought you was black, man! Yo, man, this is Zero Cool! Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's far out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Zero Cool, man! Whooo, haha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly) Well that's great. There goes MIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it up to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll hack the Gibson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll trace you like that (snaps his fingers) man, cops are gonna find you, they're gonna find you with a smoking gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucked if I care, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, even if you had the passwords, it'll take you ten minutes to get in, and you've still gotta find the files, man, I mean, the cops will have you in... five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wow, we are fried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly lighter-hearted) Never send a boy to do a woman's job. With me, we can do it in seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're both screwed. I help, we can do it in six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I gotta save all your asses. I help, we can do it in five minutes, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's go shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woo hoo! Boom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade and Kate cut through a chain link fence and jump int a dumpster at Ellingson. Kate lands on Dade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if I didn't live by a strict code of honor, I might take advantage of this situation.  Erotically, as it were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate fishes around in her pants, never breaking eye contact with Dade. She pulls out a flashlight. They start trashing. They get up to leave and are spotted by a security guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, hold it right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate pulls out a flare gun and fires it at the security guard.  He ducks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my subway defense system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikon is staring down a manhole, Cereal is fishing throug an adjacent phone company truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's way down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal emerges with a beltload of equipment and a hard ha But he forgot the most important thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ta-da!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, brain dead, the manual!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal goes back to the truck and gets a thick manual. Th phone company technician comes up from the manhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in unison, pointing down the street) TRUCK!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone company tech jumps back in the hole, Cereal and Nikon take off. INT. SECRET SERVICE BULDING. A woman is seated at the desk.  Agent Gill walks by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal emerges from the desk, between her legs. His tool belt dangles obscenely from his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone's alright. The problem must be somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal walks away with his buttcrack seriously showing. INT. ELLINGSON MINERAL OFFICES. Nikon poses as a flower delivery boy. He winds his way through the offices of Ellingson Mineral, "shoulder surfing", watching the workers entering passwords. His photographic memory captures everything.  The Plague walk past him, noticing briefly but not making the connection. INT. PLAGUE'S LOFT. The Da Vinci virus' launch/cancel prompt is up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pacing) They had a large chunk of the garbage file? How much do they know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not everything. But enough to implicate us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said the worm was untreaceable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. To civilians. But they're hackers. But don't worry. All we have to do is launch the Da Vinci virus, and then they'll all be put away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Launch the Da Vinci virus? You can't do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one believes the guilty. Besides, by the time they realize the truth, we'll be long gone with all of our money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margo starts to protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there is no right and wrong.  There is only fun and boring. A thirty year prison sentence sounds pretty dull to me.  Who do you prefer serves it, us? Or them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plague clicks on "Launch". The virus repeats its demand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless five million dollars are transferred to the following numbered account in seven days, I will capsize five tankers in the Ellingson fleet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the virus speaks, a supertanker sails on a choppy sea. INT. PLAGUE'S LOFT. Plague leaves a message on Gill's answering machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sternly) The virus goes off tomorrow morning at 10:30, and those hackers tried to get into our system again. At this point I insist you take more strenuous action, or Ellingson Mineral will hold the Secret Service responsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill gets on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly) Get me arrest warrants on Kate Libby, alias Acid Burn, Emmanuel Goldstein, alias Cereal Killer, Dade Murphy, alias Crash Override, also known as Zero Cool, and Paul Cook, alias Lord Nikon. We pick them up tomorrow morning at nine o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gill gives the order, a mysterious device under his desk blinks. Cereal put it there. INT. NIKON'S PLACE. Nikon and Cereal taped Gill's orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snoop onto them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as they snoop onto us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikon calls Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Burn. We got a little problem here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal, Nikon, Dade and Kate skate through a run down subway platform and get on the "A" Train. They go over the results of their password gathering spree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, so what have we got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we have fifty passwords, plus whatever Polaroid head here got inside Ellingson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I got a lot, alright? I don't know how many but... my head hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, everyone check this out. Hey, what's the Da Vinci virus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out. It's a memo about how they're gonna deal with those oil spills that happened on the fourteenth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What oil spills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa. Yo, brain-dead, today is the thirteenth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well this hasn't happened yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, the fourteenth, that's the same day the worm ends its run.  I mean... Da Vinci virus, didn't Phreak say that's what he was being charged with? Look... (quotes the memo) "Infecting ballast programs of Ellingson tankers" - they blame hackers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A worm AND a virus? The plot thickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate gets ready to get off the subway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa whoa whoa, where are you going, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got an idea. We've got a few hours, right, till we get arrested. So just stay low. I'm gonna go get some help. I'll beep you, okay? (to Dade) Are you coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May the Force be with you, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weird music plays, lots of weird people dance.  Razor and Blade are on stage, dancing in front of a huge speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Razor and Blade! They're flakes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're elite! Let's get 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade and Kate push through the crowd. The song changes to a fast industrial rap number, Razor and Blade leave the stage, and Dade starts getting moshed. He climbs on the stage to follow Razor and Blade. For his trouble, he is thrown back onto the crowd, who pass him around overhead. Finally the crowd lets him go.  He catches up with Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost 'em. Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade tries to explain, but is at a loss for words. They make their way to the entrance to Razor and Blade's lair. Video monitors are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A robotic arm with a revolver swings around to point at Dade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAAAUGH! I definitely don't like this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through video intercom) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm... we come in peace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade winces at his own corniness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need your help.  If you're up to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's buff. Ballsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's keep her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waste the dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun goes off. It's only a cigarette lighter! No one can accuse Razor and Blade of not having a sense of humor INT. RAZOR AND BLADE'S PLACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A virus called Da Vinci will cause oil spills at 10:30 AM Eastern Time tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's somehow connected with the worm that's stealing the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need your help to overload the Gibson so we can kill the Da Vinci virus and download the worm program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's rabid, but cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, we're very busy. A TV network that wishes to remain nameless has expressed an interest in our show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing the stench of sellout) Let's go, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Nobody said no. But you are going to need more than just two media icons like us. You need an army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! An electronic army! If I were us, I'd get on the internet, send out a major distress signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hackers of the World, Unite!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you going to take care of the cops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade just smiles. INT. DADE'S ROOM. Dade hacks into the city traffic light control system. Suddenly there is gridlock on the streets of New York City. EXT. CENTRAL PARK. Nikon is playing chess against two Hassidic Jews. Cereal's beeper goes off. It displays the message: GRAND CENTRAL HACK THE PLANET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo. I'm blowing up. It's Kate, Grand Central. Let's hit it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikon checkmates his opponent and the two leave. Dade, Cereal, Nikon, and Kate skate through the streets. Dade's program to freeze all the traffic lights on green, runs on schedule at 9:00:00 precisely. Picture New York C morning rush hour, and every traffic light is green. Inst gridlock ensues. The four skate through the traffic easil the Secret Service, now pursuing them, is stuck. Gill pun parked car in frustration. Its alarm goes off. INT. GRAND CENTRAL STATION. The four hackers skate into Grand Central Station and hea to the lowest level. They meet up with Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Joey, you made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hackers are now setting up laptops at a bank of pay phones.  Dade is wearing a "Pirate Eye" eyepiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen up, use your best viruses to buy us time, we have to get into Plague's file and copy the worm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ai! Boom boom aiaiaiaiaee! Alright, that was a little tension breaker, that had to be done, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go fix the phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal takes off to fix the phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey, take his place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take his place, man, do it. You can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey takes Cereal's place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's boot up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four boot up their machines. Various vanity screens come up on the laptops. They begin to hack. We see the inside of the Gibson. Viruses of all kinds begin to pour in. In the offices and data processing rooms, the Ellingson staff are in pandemonium. Happy faces with eye patches appear on their screens. "Sit on my interface." "Shit for Brains." "Arf Arf Arf!" Cookie monsters. INT. COMPUTER ROOM, ELLINGSON MINERAL. The big monitor shows the attack in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, it's just a minor glitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Minor glitch" with you seems to turn into a major catastrophe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main screen is filled with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a new virus in the database.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's replicating, eating up memory. What do I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Type "Cookie", you idiot. I'll head 'em off at the pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another virus appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a Zero Bug attacking all the login and overlay files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run anti-virus. Give me a systems display!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The systems display comes up. Red flashes everywhere, signifying new attacks. Plague presses a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Die, dickweeds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rabbit is in the administration system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabbit icons start to fill the systems display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send a Flu-shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabbit, Flu-shot, someone talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rabbit replicates till it overloads a file, then it spreads like cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Da Vinci Virus sings "Row Row Row Your Boat". Tanker ballasts start filling - for real. INT. GRAND CENTRAL PUBLIC PHONES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Gibson, it's finding us too fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, there's too many garbage files, I need more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're at Grand Central Station, lower level. Don't screw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secret Service and NYPD are stuck.  They turn around and head for Grand Central Station. INT. GRAND CENTRAL PUBLIC PHONES. The public phone next to Dade's rings.  Dade answers. It's The Plague. INT. COMPUTER ROOM, ELLINGSON MINERAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Game's over. Last chance to get out of this without a prison sentence.  You're not good enough to beat me, you little shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe I'm not. But we are, you asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up! Just give it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's phone rings. It's Razor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we fashionably late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hackers in England, Italy, Japan, Russia, everywhere mobilize and start attacking the Ellingson Gibson. The English hacker looks and talks suspiciously like Annie Lennox's husband. Our heroes relentlessly search for the right garbage file. INT. COMPUTER ROOM, ELLINGSON MINERAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have massive infection.  Multiple GPI and FSI viruses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming in from remote nodes. They're going after the Kernal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The System Command Processor, it's the brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancer, brain... Brain Cancer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke Ellingson arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belford, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In short, Duke, a shit storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of armed Secret Service and SWAT troops push through the crowded station looking for the hackers. INSIDE THE COMPUTER. The garbage file lights up.  The familiar psychedelic swirl of equations and fractal graphics returns. INT. GRAND CENTRAL PUBLIC PHONES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found it! I found it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the end, my friend. (smiling sickly) Thank you for calling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade is disconnected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! He got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's getting stupid busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SS and SWAT are still closing in on the hackers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey. I need you to drop your viruses, go after the worm. You're the closest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SS and SWAT push through crowds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's root slash period workspace slash period garbage period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SS are nearly there. Joey has found the file. The SS arrive.  Gill himself has his .357 drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an empty bank of payphones, the receivers are linked together and taped up. No hackers. They keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed off but determined) Ahhh Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey completes the download.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Razor and Blade) Kill the Gibson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on you son of a bitch, is that all you got, huh? Come on, let's see what else you can do! You talking to me? Huh? Hahahaha. Are you nuts? Come at me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margo and Duke are awed by Plague's imminent failure and total unprofessionalism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in the kernal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help... me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Da Vinci virus dies. The tankers stop capsizing and right themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off screen) The tankers have stopped capsizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off screen) Ballast tanks are emptying. It'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main screen lights up: ARF ARF! WE GOTCHA! MESS WITH THE BEST DIE LIKE THE REST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little pissant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gibson dies in a flash of light. INT. GRAND CENTRAL PUBLIC PHONES. The hackers cheer and congratulate each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREEZE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SS have caught up with the hackers. Agent Bob seems t be choosing which pore on which hacker's face to blow awa first. Only Joey thinks to put his hands up. As they are led away, a handcuffed Dade surrreptitiously disc with the worm into a trashcan. EXT. GRAND CENTRAL STATION. Outside, he notices Cereal, who wasn't present to be arrested. He yells to the crowd, but really is addressing Cereal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're TRASHING our rights, man! They're TRASHING the flow of data! They're TRASHING! TRASHING! TRASHING! HACK THE PLANET! HACK THE PLANET!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and get in the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understanding the hidden message) HACK THE PLANET! HACK THE PLANET!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later, Cereal is trashing through the garbage cans in Grand Central Station. Eventually he finds the disc. To Cereal's disgust, it has gum stuck to it. INT. GILL'S OFFICE. Gill phones The Plague to report the successful takedown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We caught 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red handed! You won't be having any more trouble from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Plague's place, Plague and Margo toast with champagne, giggle, and then scurry off to bed... INT. GILL'S OFFICE. Dade and Kate are there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, alright? I did it. She knows shit about computers. She... she's just my girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I suggest you modify your attitude. Because you are floating. And I'm about to flush your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The intercom beeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a Mrs. Murphy to see you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses, realizing his gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade turns on the intercom. Gill can be heard through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly) Your son is in big trouble. He has violated his probation and he has engaged in criminal activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son happens to be a genius. He understands something happening today that you won't comprehend if you live to be a hundred, and he would never use what he knows to harm a living soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Bob enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The news crew you requested is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh good. Cause I have a few things to tell them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son is facing thirty felony counts in an ongoing investigation. You face possible arrest if you do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, I don't care if I face certain death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Murphy stays right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wow, she's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The news crew interviews Gill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and attacked the Ellingson's computer network. Is the last we've seen of this type of high-tech espionage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm afraid not. Hackers are a grave threat to the national security. This incident just proves without a doubt that we need increased funding to stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikon and Joey are led in. The monitors cut into static, then Cereal appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kid cut him off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, boys and girls. It is I, the Cereal Killer, making my first coast to coast, world wide, global television appearance. Yes, that's right, I'm here to tell you about this heinous scheme hatched from within Ellingson Mineral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Razor and Blade busily work on keeping him on the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But for what, you ask? World domination? Nay. Something far more tacky. A virus called Da Vinci, that when launched, would cause Ellingson Mineral tankers to capsize was to be blamed on innocent hackers. But this virus was really the smokescreen, right. What could be so vitally important to protect that someone would create such a nasty, antisocial, very uncool virus program?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cereal is now seen and heard on the big screen in Times Square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why? Could it be to cover the tracks for this worm program? A worm that was to steal 25 million bucks. The password for this hungry little sucker belongs to Margo Wallace, head of public relations at Ellingson Mineral...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margo watches this and sits bolt upright in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...and Eugene Belford, Computer Security Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally understanding what's been going on all along) Son of a BITCH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What's this? Is this the unnamed account in the Bahamas where the money was to be stashed? I think so!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An account number scrolls below Cereal's chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo. I kinda feel like God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice echoes across the earth and among the satellites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plague? Eugene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost supernaturally, Plague is already gone. He was right next to her, stark naked in bed a second ago. INT. SECRET SERVICE OFFICES. The hackers embrace and congratulate each other again, Lauren Murphy hugs her son. INT. POLICE STATION, WOMEN'S LOCKUP. Margo Wallace has been arrested, and is being led into th women's lockup. Some of the other women grab at her expensive Italian leather jacket as she is led to her cel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know how to work a VCR, let alone a computer! Get off! Look, listen, I'll make a deal. Eugene Belford! I know where his mother is, I promise you. Get offa me! I need a lawyer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you are, Mr. Babbage.  Flight time to Tokyo should be about 14 hours today. Can I get you anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Babbage" is The Plague in disguise; he now appears about 60 years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a pillow please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pillow slides in behind his head, he reaches up to adjust it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A handcuff snaps onto his wrist. It's Gill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Let go of me! Stewardess! I'll never fly this airline again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade and Kate are on their date. Dade is smartly, somewhat androgynously dressed. Kate is heavily made up, and yes, she is wearing a dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look good in a dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would have looked better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna go for a swim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dade and Kate swimming, fully clothed, in a pool on a roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe they decided you won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't. The guys felt it was the only way I'd get a date. Anyway, you're pretty good. You're elite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? You know if you would have said so in the beginning, you would have saved yourself a whole lot of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look out at the skyline. Suddenly, the lights in three buildings change. They spell out: C         B R    A    U A    N    R S    D    N H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate laughs, honestly impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate continues laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've been having these really weird..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing his sentence) Dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss passionately.
